tweets.text:
Unblocktober is the world‚Äôs first month-long national campaign and awareness month to improve the health of our drains, sewers, watercourses and seas. 

@unblocktober @YorkshireWater @RiverCalder 

To find out how you can help visit: https://t.co/QwDQNgy7Lf

#unblocktober https://t.co/hdqhSlW2cY

Does your business deal in #FloodRiskManagement? JOIN US for our FREE @marketinghumber #WaterlineSummit webinar and help your business seize opportunities for growth in the Property Flood Resilience Market. Find out more and sign up: https://t.co/zqKBWuZV59 #FloodResilience #FIC https://t.co/06FcvUX8S6

Great to see @Dunne4Ludlow's Sewage (Inland Waters) bill published today. 

The volume of unmonitored, untreated sewage still flowing into rivers is shocking. Hope Government will support the bill, backed up with capital investment and @EnvAgency funding in the #SpendingReview. https://t.co/khjBY3HgSl

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

tweets.text: Our #flooding inquiry heard yesterday from people directly affected by floods, and their proposals included the need for @EnvAgency & @DefraGovUK to listen to local groups ‚Äì many thanks to all those who took part and @NatFloodForum for facilitating the session https://t.co/NAbt2Wf4gb

#NFCatchment representatives, @NewForestNPA and @EnvAgencySE met with @SouthernWater recently to help shape their long-term plans for the future management of their resources in the New Forest as part of a two-year consultation process.  Read on: https://t.co/jXOla8MQ1p

Today Fisheries Officers are disinfecting all of the equipment used on yesterday‚Äôs netting job at Three Sisters Recreation Area lake. 

This biosecurity procedure of ‚Äòcheck clean dry‚Äô illustrates the measures we take to reduce the risk of spreading diseases. 

#fish #Lancashire https://t.co/jZ7uJhUHNy

Our Fisheries Officers were checking & cleaning fish passes on the River Yarrow near Croston to ensure free passage for fish. Checks are carried out after recent high flows and for public safety. 

This is carried out after all heavy rainfall throughout the year.

#Lancashire https://t.co/4Zi7uDwNQo

@EnvAgency @PortsmouthWater @SouthernWater @thameswater 
Of course these 4 are not the only culprits of bad governance, poor water management and complicity in the degradation of our rivers etc. But all are failing, and we and our biodiversity pay the price of their profiteering https://t.co/vzM1s8U6gK

urls.title: Waste carriers, brokers and dealers
urls.description: beta This is a trial service ‚Äì your feedback will help us to improve it. Home Search waste carriers, brokers and dealers People or businesses who transport, buy, sell or dispose of waste, or arrange for someone els e to do so, must be registered. To check a registration, enter the registration number or business name: only carry waste they produced in the course of carrying out their business unless it is construction or demolition waste only carry (carrier), arrange (broker) or deal (dealer) in: animal

tweets.text: New river channel looking great today! Look out for us, @EnvAgencyNW and @NetworkRailLC talking about our partnership #riverrestoration project on @ITVborder tonight and @BBC_Cumbria tomorrow morning! #slowtheflow https://t.co/tLJgpNN7qa

As a precaution, we‚Äôve closed the penstock on the River Leven at Stokesley, which diverts water away from the town into a diversion channel. 

It follows heavy rainfall throughout the day. Our incident team will continue to monitor the #rainfall  across the region overnight. https://t.co/HnWjZGJMXr

Do you often use cotton balls, pads or buds?
 
Never put them down the loo as they cause blockages and harm our environment. 
 
To protect your pipes and the environment, only flush the three Ps - poo, pee and toilet paper. 

#Unblocktober #BinIt4Beaches https://t.co/of9FDrTe5i

Today, our Chief Executive Sir @JamesBevanEA spoke at #FloodandCoast2020 about the #FCERMStrategy, setting out our ambitions to create a nation resilient to flooding and coastal change until 2100.

Here‚Äôs his speech, ‚ÄòCreating Climate Resilient Places‚Äô: https://t.co/BOfK6LqVqS https://t.co/TZyHG4ivvN
Today marks 6 years of Christina - looking back at some of our special memories @OutRightIntl @EnvAgency @BritLGBTAwards @MsLadyPhyll @chattyman @Elliot_Vaughn https://t.co/mQX77bzAaF

tweets.text: I'm hearing all kinds of rumours about the latest river water quality status updated the @DefraGovUK & @EnvAgency have delayed publishing for over 9 month and it's not good, it's really not good.

@CIWEM @floodandcoast @EnvAgency We'll be discussing ADA's potential contribution towards the National FCERM Strategy Action Plan with ADA's Board of Directors tomorrow. A focus on climate, resilience and learning in low-lying catchments.

As a nation it speaks volumes about the platitudes we heap upon the environment, the empty meaningless words devoid of intent, the 25 year plans that simply perpetuate the obscenity.

If we can‚Äôt conserve some of the rarest rivers in the world how can we ever conserve the rest? https://t.co/qML6IoT4gZ

...we need to do some repairs on on the weir, part of flood-protection for #Maidenhead, #Windsor and #Eton. More info ‚¨áÔ∏è #floodware https://t.co/OiIoYQ5amU

Action plan to implement @EnvAgency FCERM strategy will be available from April says Julie Foley. Strategic overview role vital to effectively help all the partners in the strategy to work together. #FloodandCoast2020

We've completed repairs to a 40 metre slip on a flood defence embankment in #Doncaster, as part of our work to repair and improve defences for winter #WinterReady https://t.co/GshNxaUXBI https://t.co/X3VEGmmHnN

@picturespete @EnvAgency As we now know ever single river, ever single river in England is polluted.

And the @EnvAgency do what exactly?

@JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency Apply here so you, too, can help the Environment Agency destroy the planet as demonstrated by EA just approving Europe's biggest incinerator for rural Essex, belching out 625,000 tns CO2 pa, plus double WHO safety limits of cancer-causing particulates. EA facilitates pollution.

You can now use an online map to see exactly where our ground investigations & river channel works are taking place in Hebden Bridge to help develop flood defences to better protect the community. 

For more info  https://t.co/Y2tdmiVOaF @BAMNuttall 

#flooding #HebdenbridgeFAS https://t.co/FqWnGzQMjh
